originalText.plaidHtml:
Watch Dhurandhar on the big screen. I watched it 4 days ago and came away thoroughly impressed at the finesse and execution of Aditya Dhar. With a brilliant cast where none is dispensable,a tightly written script and a scintillating background score, 214 minutes isnt long enough.

This is really such a good movie that I have already seen it twice and am planning to watch it for the third time.

(Usually I don't rate movies on IMDB but I did this for this masterpiece.)

summary.originalText: This one is for the ages - brutally honest and real...!

originalText.plaidHtml:
A movie of epic proportions, this real-life 'inspired' story lays bare one of the reasons why 'Bharat' is on it's way to unlock it's true potential before it goes on to be a 'Vishwaguru'...!

The story is tight, the narrative concise and clear, the acting is superb all around, so it is Aditya Dhar's direction which brings it all together so well... This one is, indeed, for the ages, like 'Mahavatar Narasimha' and 'Article 370'. It's heartening to realize that the days of masala-fiction-tranquilizers, served long by Bollywood to keep us sedated, are well and truly over.

summary.originalText: Dhurandhar isn't just something you watch - it's an experience you carry with you.

originalText.plaidHtml:
Rarely does cinema come this close to lived reality - and when it does, it leaves an emotional imprint that's hard to shake. Dhurandhar does exactly that.

The film forces you to relive something deeply unsettling, reigniting a feeling that's almost impossible to articulate (red screen scene). It stays with you long after the screen goes dark.

And then it asks a haunting question: can you truly call yourself peaceful unless you are capable of great violence?

Dhurandhar isn't just something you watch - it's an experience you carry with you.

One of the most realistic experiences I had .Instead of stupid item sings they showed the raw material. Also songs were fire ðŸ”¥ ðŸ”¥. All the actors were great. Akshay Khanna 's aura in the 1st half was unmatched by Ranveer Singh. I am very much excited about the next part
Don't know why it is not getting the box office collections it should get.

By the end of it, I wished it was 6 hours long! Waiting for Dhurandar 2.0! You'll come out of the being a fan of unexpected people. The storyline unfolds smoothly and you can follow all the info very easily. It's the best work of Aditya Dhar till date. The nuanced subtle hints in the movie will leave you thinking...Go watch it in your nearest theater!!!

The movie is well shot and has very good story telling. This is how a spy movie be made. All the actors have performed exceptionally well. The action scenes are raw and feels realistic. The movie doesn't have any unnecessary scenes. The movie keeps you hooked throughout. It's a must watch movie in theatres.

Dhurandhar is an absolute winner! The story is gripping from start to finish, the cast is perfectly chosen, and every performance shines. The music elevates every moment, and the direction ties everything together beautifully.

And Ranveer Singh? Loved, loved him! He's electrifying on screen and delivers one of his most memorable performances.

Overall, Dhurandhar is super amazing - engaging, entertaining, and totally worth watching! ðŸŽ¬ðŸ’¥

summary.originalText: Best Spy movie made in india

originalText.plaidHtml: "This is how a true spy film should be-free from item numbers and unrealistic, over-the-top fight scenes. It delivers pure, grounded cinema. The performances are exceptional, the action feels tense and believable, and the storytelling is smooth, engaging, and beautifully crafted. A complete, satisfying spy thriller."

Intense engaging enthralling !! What a gripping thriller with such power pact performances from every actor especially Ranveer Singh ! The sound track is mind blowing ! My only complaint is the wait till March is too long ! Aditya Dhar you genius you have directed the movie so aesthetically including the most gory action sequences. Have always loved Akshay Khanna but after this movie I admire him even more as an actor but it was truly Ranveer Singh who was the show stopper show stealer everything !

The film's world-building is meticulous, presenting a morally complex underworld where strategy, loyalty, and danger constantly intersect. Ranveer Singh delivers a nuanced performance, alternating between tactical brilliance and emotional vulnerability, making his character fully engaging. Sanjay Dutt commands the screen with gravitas and menace. Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan provide layered supporting performances, and Arjun Rampal's controlled intensity enhances suspense. Sara Arjun's emotional scenes make the story's stakes feel intimate and personal. Aditya Dhar directs with finesse, orchestrating suspenseful build-up, character-driven drama, and large-scale action sequences. Cinematography captures both expansive cityscapes and quiet moments, while the music heightens tension. By the climax, the film delivers a perfect balance of emotion, strategy, and adrenaline-fueled spectacle.

summary.originalText: This is what Real Spy Movie is

originalText.plaidHtml:
Dhurandhar shows how we were fooled previously in the name of Spy Bollywood movies... Story:- it's simple Spy story but the way shown with details is superb, Every character and supporting cast is given importance. It's not Like one hero killing 10 -50 people at a time. We can clearly see the anger on his face with fear.

Technical:- Technically well executed, Cinematography, Editing, Dialogue etc.

Acting:- what an Acting, while watching movie we hate Akshay Khanna, that is ACTUALLY acting. No character is seen like Acting, we feel like they are actually the real character.

Verdict:- must watch for everyone. And Appreciate this kind of movie. Start to End the real Experience.

Yeah, this is worth all the hype. It is so brilliant, but it does have its flaws. Is it too long? Yes and it could've been cut way shorter if not for the love story angle, but it is a trademark of bollywood so what can you expect. The characters are introduced a bit hastily but each actor gives a marvelous performance. This focuses more on the story of Akshay Khanna and Ranveer Singh's character and they carried the film. The action sequences are brilliant, the choreography, the violence, and the music, just diabolical. And the ending, if the first half feels draggy, it all pays off in this wonderfully crafted climax, and it has a twist many people did see coming, but many did not. Overall, a movie worthy of all the hype, not just another animal.

summary.originalText: Ranveer, Sanjay, and the Ultimate Cast

originalText.plaidHtml: The film is a masterclass in high-stakes storytelling. Ranveer Singh delivers a layered, powerful performance, portraying both moral conflict and relentless determination. Sanjay Dutt's authority adds weight to pivotal scenes, while Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan provide subtle, intelligent support. Arjun Rampal's quiet menace keeps tension taut, and Sara Arjun's emotional authenticity provides the story's human anchor. Aditya Dhar orchestrates suspense, strategy, and action seamlessly. Cinematography captures both the grandeur of the city and the intimacy of personal moments, while the score enhances every beat of tension and emotion. By the finale, the film delivers adrenaline, shock, and deep emotional satisfaction, leaving a lasting impression.

summary.originalText: blockbuster spy movie of the year

originalText.plaidHtml: One of the most defining spy cinematic experiences of 2025 has undoubtedly blockbuster. After years of anticipation and a complete overhaul, the film soared into theatres, proving that audiences were hungry for a hero who leads with hope rather than grit. Akshay Khanna nailed his character, and Ranbir Singh in Spy Get Up is very, very unique. This is the patriot movie, which is based on a real incident.

Dhurandhar is a gripping blend of slick action, emotional storytelling, and strong character-driven drama, making it one of the more engaging Indian thrillers of the year. Scored at 8 out of 10, the film stands out for its confident direction, atmospheric tension, and a lead performance that elevates nearly every scene.

The story follows its central character-an enigmatic, morally complex figure whose past haunts every decision he makes. The writing excels in the way it balances his inner conflict with high-stakes external threats. Instead of relying only on action, the film invests time into building his personal relationships, motivations, and vulnerabilities. This makes the emotional beats feel genuinely earned.

Visually, Dhurandhar is impressive. The cinematography creates a gritty yet cinematic world, with well-composed shots and fluid action sequences that avoid unnecessary over-stylization. The background score complements the tone without overpowering it, and the pacing, though occasionally uneven in the second half, stays engaging overall.

Performances are one of the film's strongest pillars. The lead actor brings depth and intensity, portraying the character's turmoil with subtlety. The supporting cast also shines, especially in moments where the film slows down to explore trust, betrayal, and survival.

Where Dhurandhar falters slightly is in its predictability during a few key twists. Some plot points follow familiar genre beats, and certain characters could have benefited from more development. However, these shortcomings don't take away from the overall experience, which remains consistently entertaining.

In conclusion, Dhurandhar delivers a compelling combination of storytelling, action, and emotion. With strong performances and a gripping narrative at its core, it earns a solid 8/10-a must-watch for fans of stylish thrillers with substance.

Such long time i saw a real Spy thriller movie. Ranbir Singh, R Madhwan, Sanjay Dutt and Akshay Khanna acted very well Aditya Dhar Direction truly a master class level. Dhurandhar movie show that how many hidden hero sacrifices their lives to protact us from enemies country.

Now i am excited to watch Dhurandhar2.

If you only want to see the truth, and that too without any adulteration, then you must watch this film.

If you eat bitter gourd, it will taste bitter, whether you eat it with sugar or salt.

Just like the truth of this bitter gourd being bitter, Dhurandhar shows us the clear truth like a mirror. And the truth is always bitter.

Hi! This is my first ever review on IMDb. I downloaded this app just to give this movie the rating it deserves. Dil se 10/10. Had the best time at the cinema after so long and let me tell you, it was a housefull Sunday show! Ranveer, you're the best! Akshaye, Maddy, Rampal and everybody on the team did fantastically well! Kudos on making a film so detailed, so fun and heart rendering!

Great movie , great cast , fabulous acting by all , shown reality of Pakistan and please go and watch it., Go and experience the full on massy masala film which we all indians waiting from long time ,,, don't miss the chance ,
Aditya dhar has completely leveled up his skills , Bollywood can make great ., good cinema if we give money in right hands.

Just watched Dhurandhar and wow... Really glad they finally did something different with the whole Ind vs Pak angle.

No clichÃ©s, no shortcuts they actually took time to build the world and the characters, and it shows.

The film is brutal, violent, stylish... honestly right up my alley.

Yeah, some action scenes feel a bit choppy, but they're still super fun to watch.

It's that messy, chaotic kind of action that still somehow feels cool.

The conversations surprised me the most.

They're long, but not a single line feels wasted. Every word adds something tension, emotion, depth.

Zero boring moments.

The vibe is dark, gritty, and insanely immersive.

From the music to the visuals, everything pulls you deeper into the story.

Overall, Dhurandhar is bold and refreshing. A proper "do something different" film. If you like raw storytelling, stylish violence, and dialogues that actually matter, this one hits perfectly

  • Mitesh Panchal.

That Red screen presentation gave goosebumps.

Great job to the whole Team of Dhurandha.

Akshay Khanna's act was out of the box. Such a great actor!!

summary.originalText: An edge of the seat thriller that will make you wanting more!

originalText.plaidHtml:
Here's a breakdown of what this movie contains:

200% Character acting 200% Set Design 150% Music + Sound design 150% Cinematography 100% Exceptional story and script 30% violence and gore 5% propaganda

  • If violence, gore or propaganda is the reason for anyone to "boycott" this movie, know this- You're missing out on one of the most amazing cinema experiences of your life.


  • Take your family with you. You'll rob them of the experience.


  • Most importantly, stop asking around and being afraid of booking tickets. Good or bad, decide for yourself.


This movie is a collaboration, a team work. It refuses to ride on just the star power of the actors. Every script writer, lyricist, cinematographer, supporting actor, set designer, sound designer, editor, makeup artist, hair stylist, costume designer, and the long credit list have done a fab job! They all came and gave their 2000% to give us audiences a ride of a lifetime!

I went to watch this movie before any reviews were out. First day, 3rd show. I'm also not into celeb worship. So, the only motivation was to purely experience a Bollywood movie. And MAN! It. Did. Not. Disappoint.

What you see in the trailer, is what you get for 3.5 hours. By the end, you'll want to keep wanting more. No, and I mean, no OTT, piracy, small screen phones, laptops can replicate the experience. Heck, I didn't even realise Ranveer's eye color had changed while watching the trailer. It's these details that just pop out on a big screen.

Aditya Dhar has created a masterpiece through and through!

The depth and detail of the world of Lyari stays with you long after (in my case 5 days atp)...you just won't be able to shrug it off.

My soul has been craving for an immersive escape and Dhurandhar delivers like it's nobody business. You're hooked, you're connected, you're rooting for the protagonist but acting so goated, you're also rooting for the antagonist. And then they remind you, with real clips of how our agents feel working in the depths of a place with no moral compass. The anger, the shock, the intensity will keep you on the edge.

If you think you won't watch the movie because of your ideological stance, well you're smart to see through it. But don't lose out on an experience of a lifetime.

summary.originalText: High Drama, Big Action, Amazing Stars

originalText.plaidHtml: From the first confrontation to the climactic showdown, the film crafts a meticulous, high-stakes narrative. Ranveer Singh's layered performance drives the story forward, showing his character's vulnerability and cunning in equal measure. Sanjay Dutt commands every scene with gravitas, his expressions conveying unspoken history and authority. Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan enhance key sequences, their calculated dialogue delivery heightening suspense. Arjun Rampal's understated menace keeps the audience constantly uneasy, and Sara Arjun's poignant moments humanize the stakes. Aditya Dhar's direction balances multiple plotlines seamlessly, blending tense strategy scenes with breathtaking action. Cinematography captures sprawling cityscapes and claustrophobic interiors with equal precision, while the score amplifies emotional beats without overpowering them. Every twist feels earned, and the final act delivers a payoff that is both emotionally satisfying and adrenaline-charged.

summary.originalText: Big Drama with Even Bigger Impact

originalText.plaidHtml: The film thrives on the interplay of suspense, character, and action, crafting a story that is as emotionally resonant as it is thrilling. Ranveer Singh's performance anchors the narrative, his every expression revealing hidden conflicts and internal dilemmas. Dhar's direction orchestrates tension beautifully, ensuring that slow-burning sequences build anticipation without dragging. Action scenes are choreographed for impact, never sacrificing logic for spectacle. Cinematography captures the atmospheric intensity of each location, while supporting actors provide authenticity and emotional depth. The layered plot, combined with a thoughtful score, results in a cinematic experience that lingers long after the credits roll.
